User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_7_2) AppleWebKit/534.52.7 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.1.2 Safari/534.52.7

Steps to reproduce:

This is not a bug report but an enhancement request.

Of the three browsers installed on my Mac OSX machine, Firefox uses up the most real-estate *outside* the content area.  As the attached picture shows (safari, firefox, chrome from left to right), Firefox's toolbars/window-border/bookmarks combination take up more vertical space than its rival - leaving less space for content.


Actual results:

see above


Expected results:

As evidenced by the competing browsers, Firefox's toolbar(s) could go on a vertical diet.
